revision.text:
{{stub}}'''{{wp|Module_file|Tracker modules}}''', generally abbreviated as '''mods''', are similar in principle to the [[MIDI]] file format, but they include their own sound samples, instead of relying on the [[software synthesizer|synthesizer]]'s built-in samples. Contrarily to MIDI, there is no single standardized format; instead each tracker software having its own format. This also means that playback needs to be done with a compatible [[module replayer]]. The most commonly used formats are known by their file extensions and include MOD, IT, XM, etc.
[[ZDoom]] supports a variety of tracker module formats listed [[music format#Module formats|here]].
==External links== * [http://modarchive.org/ The Mod Archive] [[Category:Audio formats]]
